name: Tewa Roots Society
address: 16A Tayeh Huu U, Nambé Pueblo, NM 87506
description: Offers person-centered adventure therapy, art therapy, talk therapy, substance use counseling, and clinical case management. They prioritize services for Nambé Pueblo Tribal members, then Indigenous community members, and finally all community members

name: Southwest Pueblo Consultants & Counseling Services
description: Offers behavioral/mental health and substance abuse counseling using motivational and therapeutic techniques. They have a free Home Based Family Program and are Native American owned and operated by Robyn Atencio (Cochiti Pueblo). Telehealth sessions are available

name: UNM Health System's Native American Behavioral Health Program
address: Albuquerque, NM (multiple locations, including UNM Hospital, 2211 Lomas Blvd NE)
description: Works to improve access to culturally appropriate, quality behavioral health services in New Mexico, consulting with Native American communities and local agencies

name: Dr. April Young (Integral Counseling with Dr Young)
description: Specializes in individual and marriage therapy, utilizing psychotherapy, meditation, education, and empowerment. She is accepting new clients in person or virtually

name: Venus Etsitty (LPCC)
description: A Diné (Navajo) woman who incorporates both Indigenous and Western theoretical orientations, striving to create a safe space for clients

name: Marcus Billie (LMHC)
description: A Dine (Navajo) man specializing in undoing negative thought processes through Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, particularly in areas of trauma, mood disorders, grief/loss, anxiety, and depression

name: Allie Walker (LMSW)
description: Specializes in helping individuals and couples develop healthy relationships, providing a safe, judgment-free space

name: Lion Wolf Solutions
description: Provides counseling and therapy across New Mexico via HIPAA compliant secure online connections

name: Casa De Mi Alma
address: 920 North Alameda Boulevard, Las Cruces, New Mexico 88005
description: Offers counseling services with a holistic approach, integrating expertise in Ayurveda and Native practices

name: A New Hope Therapy Center
address: 715 East Idaho Avenue, Suite 2B, Las Cruces, NM
description: Provides compassionate, trauma-informed, and affordable mental health services, with a diverse and culturally-sensitive team
